intro: Kadsura celebica, commonly known as the Celebes kadsura, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red berries that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
